events.message: The customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred at an intersection, causing significant damage to the front bumper and headlights.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to keywords indicating car and collision-related damages.
An agent specializing in auto insurance claims has been assigned to assess and guide the customer throughout the process.
The customer received official acknowledgment of their claim submission along with information on the next steps to take.
The insurance company requested photos of the damaged vehicle and a copy of the police report to proceed with the investigation.
Customer uploaded all requested documents, including detailed photos of the accident scene and the official police report.
The insurance investigation team initiated a full review of submitted evidence and contacted witnesses to verify the details.
Investigation concluded confirming the customer’s report and establishing liability with sufficient evidence.
The insurer proposed a settlement offer covering the damages and repair costs as assessed by their auto damage expert.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the offer and praised the timeliness and clarity of communication throughout.
The settlement was formally approved by the claims department following customer agreement and final review.
Payment for the approved claim amount was issued and transferred to the customer’s designated bank account.
The claim file was officially closed after confirming receipt of payment and customer satisfaction with the resolution.
All claim documentation and correspondence were securely archived for future reference and compliance purposes.
